front.title: Requirements for Distributed Control of ASR, SI/SV and TTS Resources

abstract.t: This document outlines the needs and requirements for a protocol to control distributed speech processing of audio streams. By speech processing, this document specifically means automatic speech recognition (ASR), speaker recognition - which includes both speaker identification (SI) and speaker verification (SV) - and text-to- speech (TTS). Other IETF protocols, such as SIP and RTSP, address rendezvous and control for generalized media streams. However, speech processing presents additional requirements that none of the extant IETF protocols address.
